page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
This block covers a large portion of the Parish of Cairnie. It is a rural area with rounded hills and valleys. A large part of the area is covered with forest growing mainly on the slopes of the Bin - Bin is a Scots word meaning hill - so we do not refer to the Bin Hill.
There is a small clachan or hamlet of about 30 houses, the school,the local community hall and the church. A short distance away is a Petrol Filling Station with adjoining cafe.
There are a few farms nestling at the foot of the Bin.,
